result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:15 PM Defendant Ryan James Rasmussen appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl Nelson appears by phone, ADA Kaley Walker  appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $10,000.00 signature bond w/conditions of Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Not to enter any bars, taverns or liquor stores where alcohol is the primary sales/service & Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. , no objection. Court so orders. Waive the time limits. DE does not qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:23 pm.
